author: Mehboob Jeelani
text:
To meet Congress workers, entrepreneurs, and tribal groups

With Assembly elections in Assam round the corner, Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will visit the State on Friday to hold public meetings and a padayatra the following day.

“He [Rahul] will meet panchayat level Congress workers, entrepreneurs, and leaders of tribal groups,” said C.P. Joshi, senior Congress leader and general secretary in-charge for Assam.

“We are positive that we will win,” he said, adding that the BJP’s alleged attempts to mobilise voters by whipping up communal tensions had no takers in the State. Mr. Gandhi will land in Silchar district at 1 p.m. and head straight to upper reaches of Assam, where the BJP has reportedly poached Congress leaders who exert a strong influence in the business communities who own large swathes of tea plantations and employ local labourers.

Abdul Hamid, Congress general secretary in Assam, told The Hindu that Mr. Gandhi would also go on a padayatra with a hope to establish relations with the tribal population, which was largely affiliated with the Asom Gana Parishad. The AGP had entered into an alliance with the BJP and agreed to contest 24 out of 126 seats. The AGP has been hit by intra-party rifts ever since it joined hands with the BJP. A Congress leader in Assam said his party was trying to “poach” dissenting leaders of the AGP.
title: Rahul to hold public meetings, padayatra in poll-bound Assam
